intro: Microcos stylocarpoides, commonly known as the African sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. The plant features simple, linear leaves and produces small, white or pale blue flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Microcos stylocarpoides is adapted to arid environments and is often used in traditional medicine.
